data.title: portuguese music
data.meta_description: Anyone happen to know any good music, bands, songs that are in portuguese?
data.text:
No, but I can find out.

One of my buddies is from Cape Verde off The Coast of Africa. I guess it is considered part of Africa? Anyway, they are portuguese and he has an increadible library of awesome portuguese music of all flavors.

I love going to his house because his music is so good.

We are working on a rythmic latin sounding piece with portuguese lyrics right now called Return to My Island and the song is about how he misses Cape Verde and hopes to go back some day. It is a great song and I cant wait to get it finished so we can share it with people.

No, but I can find out.

One of my buddies is from Cape Verde off The Coast of Africa. I guess it is considered part of Africa? Anyway, they are portuguese and he has an increadible library of awesome portuguese music of all flavors.

I love going to his house because his music is so good.

We are working on a rythmic latin sounding piece with portuguese lyrics right now called Return to My Island and the song is about how he misses Cape Verde and hopes to go back some day. It is a great song and I cant wait to get it finished so we can share it with people.

Wow that would be very useful. If i knew any potuguese people it would be of been easier but sadly i don't. Once your song is done make sure to post it or something, i would love too give it a listen.

A few days ago one of my buddies introduced me to the band Xutos e Pontapes and i am really liking them. Although i do not understand the language much, the music is beautiful. I am especially liking Homem do Leme, its slow but it is very musical to me.

I'm not familiar with any Portuguese rock band... but Portugal's own music genre, Fado, is pretty great.

Check out the like of Amalia Rodrigues, Mariza, or Cristina Branco, for example (in particular her first album). You'll find plenty of videos on youtube. I'll try to post some later today. Of course there is a whole range of artists within the genre, from the most traditional to the most modern (I think Madredeus was a popular example of modern, fado-influenced music).

Brazil (A.C. Jobim, Joao Gilberto, Marisa Monte, Vinicius de Moraes/Toquinho, Paulinho da Viola, Caetano Veloso, Carlinhos Brown, Tom Ze, Nacao Zumbi, Tribalistas, etc, etc. ) is a musical world in its own right, with a various genres (samba, bossa, forro, choro, mengue beat, etc). Certainly worth exploring.

And for Cape Verde music ("morna"), start with the star of the genre, Cesaria Evora.

Here again, I'll try to be more specific later tonight when I have more time.

There was a thread some time ago where there was a doubt about what guitar was tedio boys' guitar man playing. It was a tenesse rose. His name is Paulo Furtado and he is portuguese. I know it because I read in his new band's blog (Wraygunn) that it got stolen in Paris in a gig and he was really sad.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kTf8yt1rpCU
